questions.text: A middle-aged man who is a business executive came to the ophthalmology department with a sudden diminution of vision. Suspecting a CSR case, what other features are NOT likely to be present in the patient?

options.label: A
options.text: Distorted images are usually accompanied by it

options.label: B
options.text: Diminution of vision accompanied by a Scotoma

options.label: C
options.text: Acquired Hypermetropia seen

options.label: D
options.text: Fundus shows a honeycomb appearance

questions.correct_answer: D. Fundus shows a honeycomb appearance
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Fundus shows a honeycomb appearance A honeycomb appearance is seen in Cystoid Macular Oedema, while CSR has a Ring-shaped reflex. The middle-aged male patient whose job includes intense stress throughout suggests Central Serous Retinopathy. The Clinical Features include Sudden onset Painless diminution of vision

Highyeild:

Fluid accumulates in the Subretinal Space. Edema may be superficial or deep to the retinal pigment epithelium.

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options: - Diminution is accompanied by scotoma (Option B) Metamorphopsia , aka distorted images, is also a finding (Option A) It shows Acquired Hypermetropia , which can be corrected by Convex lenses (Option C) Ring Shaped Reflex is a characteristic finding of CSR (Option D)

Extraedge:

FFA shows Smokestack or insult appearance due to a defect in Bruch's membrane OCT shows a collection of Subretinal fluid in the macular area

questions.text: A 45-year-old male came to the emergency department with a sudden painless vision loss. On further inquiry, he was known to be stressed throughout the day due to his job. After several investigations, it was diagnosed to be Central Serous Retinopathy. Which of the following management options about CSR is NOT TRUE?

options.label: A
options.text: The initial management of choice is to wait and watch as it resolves.

options.label: B
options.text: Visual acuity becomes normal after it resolves, but some subjective symptoms don't resolve

options.label: C
options.text: Steroids are the mainstay of treatment if oedema persists

options.label: D
options.text: Argon laser beam is used to treat the leak if Edema persists for more than three months

questions.correct_answer: C. Steroids are the mainstay of treatment if oedema persists
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Steroids are the mainstay of treatment if oedema persists Steroids are the treatment of choice for Cystoid Macular Oedema (and not CSR) CME: There is a collection of fluid in the outer plexiform ( Henle’s layer) and an inner nuclear layer of the retina centered around the foveola. Ophthalmoscopy shows a “ honeycomb appearance of the macula.” It is a late postoperative complication of cataract surgery. There is a role of prostaglandin in the pathogenesis of CME. Anterior vitrectomy is recommended when CME with vitreous incarceration occurs.

Highyeild:

After cataract surgery, Anti- prostaglandin [ indomethacin, flurbiprofen, ketorolac ] is recommended in the prophylaxis of CME.

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options: - The usual management of Central Serous Retinopathy is to WAIT and WATCH because the condition resolves itself in 1 to 3 months. (Option A) The visual acuity becomes normal by this period, but some subjective symptoms usually persist even after this period. During this period, the Acquired Hypermetropia (visual acuity abnormality) can be corrected using Convex glasses. (Option B) Even if Edema persists for over three months, Argon Laser may be used to stop the leak. The main is to produce a burn enough to blanch the Retinal pigment epithelium . (Option D)

Extraedge:

Decreased vision with FFA [ fundus fluorescein Angiography] showing “flower petal appearance.”

questions.text: A male patient in his mid-30s had come to the emergency department due to a sudden diminution of vision four months ago. The ophthalmologist on duty, after certain investigations, had reassured him that it would mostly resolve spontaneously. Four months later, he visited the Department, mentioning his symptoms persisted. Which of the following statements about further management plans and complications related to the condition is NOT TRUE?

options.label: A
options.text: Argon laser Is the treatment of choice if oedema persists for over three months.

options.label: B
options.text: Recurrence of this condition is rare

options.label: C
options.text: Geographic Atrophy of RPE is a usual complication

options.label: D
options.text: Another complication include new vessel infiltration and the formation of a fibrovascular core

questions.correct_answer: B. Recurrence of this condition is rare
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Recurrence of this condition is rare Recurrences are Frequent in the case of Central Serous Retinopathy . The above Clinical vignette suggests a case of Central Serous Retinopathy. The ophthalmologist has reassured the patient about his condition as it must be a self-resolving condition which points to a diagnosis of CSR. The usual management of Central Serous Retinopathy is to WAIT and WATCH because the condition resolves itself in 1 to 3 months . Fundus Fluorescein Angiography, where Intravenous Fluorescein dye is injected to check for fluid leakage . This would reveal fluid leakage through a defect seen in the layer of Bruch's membrane.

Highyeild:

Smokestack pattern /Mushroom Appearance is a characteristic feature of Central Serous Retinopathy.

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options: - Even if Edema persists for over three months, Argon Laser may be used to stop the leak. The main is to produce a burn enough to blanch the Retinal pigment epithelium. (Option A) Recurrences are usually frequently occurring. Option: B . As a result, it produces degeneration of RPE, known as retinal pigment epithelium decompensation. Option:C,D.Complications include geographical atrophy of the RPE and vascular infiltration of the sub-pigment epithelial space progressing to form a fibrovascular scar and RPE tearing.

Extraedge:

Other findings include Ring-shaped Reflex and subretinal fluid accumulation (seen in OCT) Smokestack appearance/Mushroom Appearance in CSR

Sudden painless loss of vision b. Younger age group is a good prognosis c. Steroids are the mainstay treatment d. Prostaglandin derivatives are a risk factor. Select the correct answer from the given below code:

options.label: A
options.text: a & b - Cystoid macular Edema, c & d - Central Serous Retinopathy

options.label: B
options.text: a & c - Cystoid Macular Oedema, b & d - Central Serous Retinopathy

Solution:

a & b - Central Serous Retinopathy, a, c&d - Cystoid Macular Oedema a & b - Central Serous Retinopathy a,c&d - Cystoid Macular Oedema Sudden Painless Diminution of Vision is a finding of both CSR and CME . A fluid leakage through a defect is seen in the layer of Bruch's membrane. This results in a Smokestack pattern /Mushroom Appearance, a characteristic feature of Central Serous Retinopathy.
